intro: Struthanthus retroflexus, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting adaptations such as succulent stems and reduced leaves to conserve water. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract pollinators like bees and moths. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds.
